Posted By: FragNutMK1 (2/25/2010 3:59:15 AM)

posts.post_content:
[Ritual of the Machine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ritual of the Machine) + [Grave Pact](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grave Pact ) = psychological trauma and profound demoralisation of your opponent!
  
   
Although it may initially seem less appealing than cards with a similar function, such as [Enslave](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Enslave) or [Treacherous Urge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Treacherous Urge) due to its drawback, this card actually works amazingly well in a sacrifice deck. Run it with [Grave Pact](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grave Pact) and sacrifice an [Ichorid](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ichorid) or [Bloodghast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodghast) and suddenly its drawback becomes another strength.
  
   
It can be a decisive endgame play, great for breaking down defences if you are trying to land a blow to use [Hatred](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hatred) of [Howl from Beyond](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Howl from Beyond) to finish off your opponent.
  
   
Great flavour card too!
posts.html:
Ritual of the Machine + Grave Pact = psychological trauma and profound demoralisation of your opponent!

Although it may initially seem less appealing than cards with a similar function, such as Enslave or Treacherous Urge due to its drawback, this card actually works amazingly well in a sacrifice deck. Run it with Grave Pact and sacrifice an Ichorid or Bloodghast and suddenly its drawback becomes another strength.

It can be a decisive endgame play, great for breaking down defences if you are trying to land a blow to use Hatred of Howl from Beyond to finish off your opponent.

Great flavour card too!
Report Abuse

posts.post_content:
Yeah, Grave Pact would work with this, because sacing a creature is an additional cost, he would sac a creature, because of Grave Pact before it resolves, and then you target whatever you were after.  
  
Hooray, updated oracle text?
posts.html:

Hooray, updated oracle text?

Posted By: SquirePath (1/9/2012 7:39:21 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Highly underrated. In a dedicated sacrifice deck this is better than standard removal. If you put it in the right deck, it's almost as good as [Treachery](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Treachery). As it stands I just consider it to be a better version of [Control Magic](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Control Magic), because there's no mucking about with auras.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
@Squirepath  
You target on cast, not resolution. You also sac on cast, so you gain control of the creature after grave pact's trigger resolves.
